meanings.definition: A person who lives in or is from the bush.
meanings.sent1: The bushies in our town are experts at surviving in the wilderness.
meanings.sent2: The bushies gathered around the campfire to share stories of the forest.
meanings.sent3: The bushies decided to have a bushcraft competition to see who could build the best shelter.
meanings.sent4: She was as wild and free as the bushies, unafraid of the unknown.
meanings.sent5: The bushies' connection to nature was so strong, they could sense changes in the weather.

meanings.definition: A group of bushes or shrubs.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with colorful bushies of all shapes and sizes.
meanings.sent2: The path through the park was lined with beautiful bushies in full bloom.
meanings.sent3: The bushies near the playground provided the perfect hiding spot for the children's game.
meanings.sent4: The bushies swayed gently in the breeze, creating a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The dense bushies shielded the birds from the harsh winter winds.

meanings.definition: A slang term for pubic hair.
meanings.sent1: The comedian made a joke about bushies during his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent2: She decided to trim her bushies for a cleaner look.
meanings.sent3: The awkward silence fell over the room after someone mentioned bushies in the conversation.
meanings.sent4: He blushed when he accidentally walked in on his roommate trimming his bushies.
meanings.sent5: The actress had to wear a wig to cover her bushies for the movie scene.
